content:
GlobalizationSection Class

In this Article

Defines configuration settings that are used to support the globalization infrastructure of Web applications. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class GlobalizationSection : System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ConfigurationElement
  • System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection
  • GlobalizationSection

Remarks

The GlobalizationSection class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the content of the globalization section of the configuration file.

Constructors summary

GlobalizationSection()

Initializes a new instance of the GlobalizationSection class by using default settings.

Properties summary

Culture

Gets or sets a value specifying the default culture for processing incoming Web requests.
EnableBestFitResponseEncoding

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the best-fit character encoding for a response is enabled.
EnableClientBasedCulture

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the stem.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture* and stem.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture* properties should be based on the HttpRequestHeader header field value that is sent by the client browser.
FileEncoding

Gets or sets a value specifying the default encoding for .aspx, .asmx, and .asax file parsing.
Properties
RequestEncoding

Gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP requests.
ResourceProviderFactoryType

Gets or sets the factory type of the resource provider.
ResponseEncoding

Gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP responses.
ResponseHeaderEncoding

Gets or sets a value specifying the header encoding of HTTP responses.
UICulture

Gets or sets a value specifying the default culture for processing locale-dependent resource searches.

Methods summary

PostDeserialize()
PreSerialize(XmlWriter)

Constructors

  • GlobalizationSection()

    Initializes a new instance of the GlobalizationSection class by using default settings.

    public GlobalizationSection ();

    Remarks

    The GlobalizationSection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the GlobalizationSection class by using the GetSection method.

Properties

  • Culture

    Gets or sets a value specifying the default culture for processing incoming Web requests.

    public string Culture { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The default culture for processing incoming Web requests.

    Remarks

    The Culture property returns the default culture for processing incoming Web requests.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the Culture property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the GlobalizationSection class. 

            // Display Culture property.
        Console.WriteLine("Culture: {0}",
          configSection.Culture);

            ' Display Culture property.
        Console.WriteLine("Culture: {0}", _
         configSection.Culture)
  • EnableBestFitResponseEncoding

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the best-fit character encoding for a response is enabled.

    public bool EnableBestFitResponseEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the best-fit character encoding for a response is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is false.

  • EnableClientBasedCulture

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the stem.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture* and stem.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture* properties should be based on the HttpRequestHeader header field value that is sent by the client browser.

    public bool EnableClientBasedCulture { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture* and stem.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture* should be based on the HttpRequestHeader header field value sent by the client browser; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    When the EnableClientBasedCulture property is enabled, the Culture and UICulture properties are based on the HttpRequestHeader header field value that is sent by the client browser. If the HttpRequestHeader header value cannot be mapped to a specific culture, the Culture and UICulture values are used. The default value is false.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the EnableClientBasedCulture property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the GlobalizationSection class. 

            // Display EnableClientBasedCulture property.
        Console.WriteLine("EnableClientBasedCulture: {0}", 
          configSection.EnableClientBasedCulture);

            ' Display EnableClientBasedCulture property.
        Console.WriteLine("EnableClientBasedCulture: {0}", _
         configSection.EnableClientBasedCulture)
  • FileEncoding

    Gets or sets a value specifying the default encoding for .aspx, .asmx, and .asax file parsing.

    public System.Text.Encoding FileEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Encoding

      The default encoding value.

    Remarks

    The FileEncoding property specifies the default encoding that is used to interpret the data that is included in the .aspx, .asmx, and .asax file types. If the file encoding is specified in the Web.config file, the actual file must be saved in the same encoding. Unicode files and UTF-8 files that are saved with the byte order mark prefix IsByteOrdered property are automatically recognized regardless of the value of the FileEncoding.

    If the FileEncoding property setting for the server or application is configured to use UTF-16, and if UTF-16 is not the encoding that is used for an .aspx page in the scope of the configuration file, the output that is sent to the client browser is corrupted. For this reason, ensure that the configured FileEncoding value matches the encoding that is used in the .aspx page.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the FileEncoding property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the GlobalizationSection class. 

            // Display FileEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("FileEncoding: {0}", 
          configSection.FileEncoding);

            ' Display FileEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("FileEncoding: {0}", _
         configSection.FileEncoding)
  • Properties
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ConfigurationPropertyCollection

      To be added.

  • RequestEncoding

    Gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP requests.

    public System.Text.Encoding RequestEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Encoding

      The content encoding of HTTP requests. The default is UTF-8.

    Remarks

    The RequestEncoding property specifies the assumed encoding of each incoming HTTP request, including posted data and query-string data. If the request comes with a request header containing a HttpRequestHeader field, the HttpRequestHeader field of the request header overrides the RequestEncoding of the configuration.

    The default encoding is UTF-8, specified in the globalization section of the Machine.config file that was created when the .NET Framework was installed. If the RequestEncoding property is not specified in the Machine.config or Web.config file, encoding defaults to the Regional Options locale setting on the computer. For single-server applications, the RequestEncoding and ResponseEncoding properties should be the same. When using multiple server applications where the default server encodings are different, you can use local Web.config files to vary the RequestEncoding and ResponseEncoding properties.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the RequestEncoding property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the GlobalizationSection class. 

            // Display RequestEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("RequestEncoding: {0}",
          configSection.RequestEncoding);

            ' Display RequestEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("RequestEncoding: {0}", _
         configSection.RequestEncoding)
  • ResourceProviderFactoryType

    Gets or sets the factory type of the resource provider.

    public string ResourceProviderFactoryType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The factory type of the resource provider.

  • ResponseEncoding

    Gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP responses.

    public System.Text.Encoding ResponseEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Encoding

      The content encoding of HTTP responses. The default is UTF-8.

    Remarks

    The ResponseEncoding property gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP responses. The default encoding is UTF-8.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the ResponseEncoding property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the GlobalizationSection class. 

            // Display ResponseEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("ResponseEncoding: {0}",
          configSection.ResponseEncoding);

            ' Display ResponseEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("ResponseEncoding: {0}", _
         configSection.ResponseEncoding)
  • ResponseHeaderEncoding

    Gets or sets a value specifying the header encoding of HTTP responses.

    public System.Text.Encoding ResponseHeaderEncoding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Encoding

      The header encoding of HTTP responses. The default is UTF-8.

    Remarks

    The ResponseHeaderEncoding property gets or sets a value specifying the header encoding of HTTP responses. The default encoding is UTF-8.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the ResponseHeaderEncoding property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the GlobalizationSection class. 

            // Display ResponseHeaderEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("ResponseHeaderEncoding: {0}", 
          configSection.ResponseHeaderEncoding);

            ' Display ResponseHeaderEncoding property.
        Console.WriteLine("ResponseHeaderEncoding: {0}", _
         configSection.ResponseHeaderEncoding)
  • UICulture

    Gets or sets a value specifying the default culture for processing locale-dependent resource searches.

    public string UICulture { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The default culture for processing locale-dependent resource searches.

    Remarks

    The UICulture property specifies the default culture for processing locale-dependent resource searches.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the UICulture property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the GlobalizationSection class. 

            // Display UICulture property.
        Console.WriteLine("UICulture: {0}",
          configSection.UICulture);

            ' Display UICulture property.
        Console.WriteLine("UICulture: {0}", _
         configSection.UICulture)
